text: When I notice impulse buying urges, I recognize them and choose to pause and control spending instead.
During moments when emotions push me to buy, I notice it and choose to wait and think instead.
When I feel the pull to buy impulsively, I notice it and choose to pause and evaluate value instead.
I let not being able to control impulses prevent me from avoiding unnecessary purchases and thinking before buying.
When I notice myself controlling impulses, I recognize it and choose to maintain those thoughtful patterns.
I see when buying urges appear, and I choose to wait and think before purchasing instead.
When I feel the urge to let emotions control buying, I notice it and choose to pause and delay instead.
I let not identifying impulse patterns prevent me from controlling urges and avoiding unnecessary purchases effectively.
When I notice impulse control working, I recognize it and choose to strengthen those thoughtful patterns.
I recognize when buying urges appear, and I choose to pause and think before purchasing instead.
When I feel the pull to buy without thinking, I notice it and choose to wait and evaluate instead.
I let problems from not controlling impulses prevent me from avoiding unnecessary purchases and thinking before buying.
When I notice thoughtful buying working, I recognize it and choose to strengthen those control patterns.
I see when buying needs control, and I choose to pause and think before purchasing instead.
When I feel the urge to let impulses control buying, I notice it and choose to wait and delay instead.
I let not being able to control impulses prevent me from avoiding unnecessary purchases effectively.
When I notice myself maintaining impulse control, I recognize it and choose to strengthen those patterns.
I recognize when buying urges appear, and I choose to pause and evaluate value before purchasing instead.
When I feel the pull to let emotions drive buying, I notice it and choose to wait and think instead.
I let not identifying impulse control abilities prevent me from avoiding unnecessary purchases and thinking before buying effectively.
